content.raw: Thanks for the inputs. After 3 unsuccessful attempts, we got the docker image running. However, joint_states topic was not publishing anything. When I tried `gz stats` the response was Gazebo server is not running. `ROS_MASTER_URI` and `ROS_IP` were set correctly on field and rostopic list was showing all the topics. On simulator machine, I could see gzserver and gzclient process but `ROS_MASTER_URI` and `ROS_IP` were not set. I couldn't set it either as that should be done before we start the roscore.  Given we have only 2X2 more hours to go (20X2 minutes of which are spent in building the image), how can we effectively use it to troubleshoot if the issue is with simulator machine or our Dockerfile?

When I tried gz stats the response was Gazebo server is not running. ROS_MASTER_URI and ROS_IP were set correctly on field and rostopic list was showing all the topics. On simulator machine, I could see gzserver and gzclient process but ROS_MASTER_URI and ROS_IP were not set. I couldn't set it either as that should be done before we start the roscore. Given we have only 2X2 more hours to go (20X2 minutes of which are spent in building the image), how can we effectively use it to troubleshoot if the issue is with simulator machine or our Dockerfile?
